title: Après une frappe meurtrière à Beyrouth, Israël dit avoir visé un haut cadre du Hezbollah
summary: Israël a annoncé avoir mené, dimanche, une frappe sur la banlieue sud de Beyrouth visant "le chef d'état-major" du Hezbollah pro-iranien. Cette attaque a fait au moins cinq morts et 28 blessés, selon un bilan du ministère libanais de la Santé.

title: Gaza : la Défense civile annonce 21 morts dans des frappes israéliennes
summary: La trêve a encore été fragilisée samedi dans la bande de Gaza, où des frappes israéliennes ont fait au moins 21 morts selon la Défense civile locale, Israël affirmant riposter à une attaque du Hamas et avoir tué cinq de ses cadres.

summary: Claire Duhamel, notre correspondante à Jérusalem, analyse la situation.

title: Au Sud-Liban, une étude révèle le "danger persistant" des frappes israéliennes au phosphore blanc
summary: En cartographiant 248 frappes, une enquête menée par un chercheur en sources ouvertes, Ahmad Baydoun, met en lumière l’utilisation par Israël du phosphore blanc lors du dernier conflit au Sud-Liban, entre octobre 2023 et novembre 2024, dont les effets sur la santé, l’agriculture et l’environnement restent particulièrement préoccupants.

title: Des frappes font 21 morts à Gaza, Israël dit avoir tué cinq cadres du Hamas
summary: La trêve a encore été fragilisée, samedi, dans la bande de Gaza où des frappes israéliennes ont fait au moins 21 morts, selon la Défense civile locale. Israël a affirmé de son côté riposter à une attaque du Hamas et avoir tué cinq cadres du mouvement islamiste palestinien.

title: Sahara occidental, Moyen-Orient... Comment le tracé des frontières joue un rôle dans les conflits
summary: De l’Afrique à l’Asie, du Sahara occidental à Kaliningrad, de simples tracés sur une carte ont parfois propulsé des peuples dans des univers contrariés. Entretien avec Jean-Baptiste Veber, qui nous explique comment les cartes ont généré des tensions géopolitiques et dessiné le monde contemporain.

title: Syrie : premiers procès des massacres intercommunautaires s'ouvrent à Alep
summary: En Syrie, le premier procès des massacres intercommunautaires de mars dernier s'est ouvert à Alep. Un procès qui se veut très symbolique, en s'inscrivant dans le cadre du processus de justice transitionnelle. Il s'agit du premier procès publiquement accessible depuis la chute de Bachar al-Assad.

title: Crash d'avion à Dubaï : une démonstration aérienne vire au cauchemar
summary: Un avion de chasse indien s'est écrasé vendredi lors d'une démonstration aérienne au salon aéronautique de Dubaï aux Emirats arabes unis, tuant son pilote.

title: En Cisjordanie occupée, 30 000 déplacés palestiniens face à une "crise de santé mentale"
summary: Dix mois après l'opération "Mur de fer" menée par Israël en Cisjordanie occupée, plus de 30 000 personnes de trois camps de réfugiés restent déplacées et multiplient les appels à l’aide. Ce déplacement prolongé a dégénéré en une grave "crise sanitaire" avec notamment des conséquences psychologiques estime un coordinateur de l'ONG Médecins sans frontières.

title: L'UE promet une enveloppe de 88 millions d'euros en faveur de l'Autorité palestinienne
summary: Quelque soixante délégations rassemblant les 27, les pays arabes et plusieurs organisations internationales se sont retrouvés jeudi à Bruxelles. À cette occasion, l'UE a annoncé un chèque de 88 millions d'euros pour soutenir l'Autorité palestinienne, dont le rôle reste incertain dans la bande de Gaza dévastée par la guerre menée par Israël contre le Hamas.

title: Une “célébration du massacre 7 octobre” organisée en Syrie : ce que l'on sait

Mais l’événement en question, programmé localement à Alep, n’aurait pas été approuvé par le ministère syrien de la Culture et aurait été annulé quelques heures après son annonce.

title: Grève monstre en vue en Belgique pour s’opposer à la cure d’austérité voulue par le gouvernement

On s’attend à une paralysie des services publics, mais aussi à des blocages dans le privé, syndicats et partis de gauche s’opposant farouchement au budget établi par le premier ministre Bart De Wever.

title: Les îles Salomon toujours menacées par les bombes de la bataille de Guadalcanal

title: Hamas affirms commitment to first phase of Gaza truce deal
summary:
Hamas affirms commitment to first phase of Gaza truce deal

A delegation of Hamas leaders met with the director of the Egyptian General Intelligence on Sunday to discuss developments regarding the Gaza ceasefire agreement.

"The delegation affirmed the movement's commitment to implementing the first phase of the agreement, emphasising the importance of halting the ongoing [Israeli] violations that threaten to undermine the agreement," the press release said.

The Palestinian movement also discussed the issue of fighters stranded in Rafah, noting that communication with them has been cut off.

title: Report: Israeli assassination of Hezbollah military commander confirmed
summary:
Report: Israeli assassination of Hezbollah military commander confirmed

A Lebanese security source told Al Jazeera that Israel assassinated Hezbollah military commander Haytham Ali Tabatabai in a strike targeting Beirut’s southern suburbs, colloquially known as Dahiyeh.

Meanwhile, Israel’s Channel 12, citing a senior security source, reported that the strike was successful.

The attack struck an apartment building in the densely populated Haret Hreik area of Dahiyeh.

title: Israel kills at least five in Lebanon
summary:
Israel kills at least five in Lebanon

Lebanese medical sources told Al Jazeera that at least five people were killed and 20 others were wounded in an Israeli strike targeting the southern suburb of Beirut on Sunday.

title: Israeli gunboat shoots Palestinians, killing child
summary:
Israeli gunboat shoots Palestinians, killing child

An Israeli gunboat shot at Palestinian civilians on the coast of Rafah, southern Gaza, killing a child and injuring several others, local media reported.

title: Reports of more Israeli attacks in Lebanon
summary:
Reports of more Israeli attacks in Lebanon

Attacks are being reported in the Beqaa region of eastern Lebanon following Israeli air strikes on the capital, Beirut.

This is the latest in a string of Israeli violations since the ceasefire came into effect last year.

title: BREAKING: Israel bombs Beirut's southern suburb
summary:
BREAKING: Israel bombs Beirut's southern suburb

An Israeli air strike hit the southern suburbs of Beirut, Lebanon, on Sunday.

The Israeli army said it carried out a "precise strike targeting a key Hezbollah" member.

Local media reported that the strike struck an apartment in a densely populated area.

title: Lebanon: Israel targets key Hezbollah leader in Beirut strike
summary:
Lebanon: Israel targets key Hezbollah leader in Beirut strike

Submitted by MEE staff on Sun, 11/23/2025 - 12:50
Bombing in southern Beirut suburb is first without warning since last year’s ceasefire
People gather as they look at the debris following a targeted Israeli military strike on a residential building in the Haret Hreik neighbourhood of Beirut’s southern suburbs on 23 November 2025 (AFP/Ibrahim Amro)
Off

An Israeli air strike targeted a senior Hezbollah leader in the Lebanese capital, Beirut, on Sunday, marking the first such attack without warning since last year’s ceasefire.

The strike hit an apartment building in the densely populated Haret Hreik area of Dahiyeh, the southern suburbs of the city.

The Lebanese health ministry said one person was killed and 21 were wounded, though their identities have not been immediately released.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu confirmed that the strike “in the heart of Beirut” targeted what he described as "Hezbollah’s chief of staff".

Israeli media identified the target as Haytham Ali Tabatabai, saying he was the group’s de facto military chief and second-in-command after Secretary General Sheikh Naim Qassem.

Hezbollah has yet to issue an official comment.

A source from the group told Al Araby TV that a senior figure was targeted, but there was no precise information about his identity. 

Israel and Hezbollah signed a ceasefire in November 2024, ending months of clashes that had escalated into full-scale war in September 2024.

During the conflict, Israel killed Hezbollah’s long-time chief Hassan Nasrallah, his deputy and several other senior figures, dealing a major blow to the group’s leadership and capabilities.

Israel has routinely violated the ceasefire, carrying out air strikes deep inside Lebanese territory. According to the Lebanese health ministry, at least 331 people have been killed and around 1,000 wounded since the ceasefire took effect.

Most strikes occurred in southern Lebanon. On a few occasions, Israel targeted Dahiyeh, but usually after issuing evacuation warnings.

Hezbollah has not launched any retaliatory attacks for nearly a year.

Israeli media and officials have recently suggested that Israel may launch another offensive against Lebanon, citing alleged attempts by Hezbollah to rebuild its capabilities.

Reports from Israel conflicted over whether the attack was coordinated with the United States. Some said Washington was aware that Israel planned to escalate in Lebanon, but did not know the timing or location of the strike.

Israel's war on Lebanon
Israel targets key Hezbollah leader in Beirut bombing

title: Gaza's civil defence warns of heavy storms amid a shortage in aid and fuel
summary:
Gaza's civil defence warns of heavy storms amid a shortage in aid and fuel

The civil defence in Gaza warned that the population is expected to face “heavy rain and strong winds” amid a lack of basic necessities and continuing suffering from the effects of war.

In a press release issued by the General Directorate of Civil Defense in the Gaza Strip on Sunday, it said it has mobilised its teams and limited resources to address the "negative impacts of this storm", particularly for displaced families.

It added that the fuel crisis has resurfaced, urging international organisations to intervene and allow fuel aid into the strip.

"Ignoring this urgent intervention will only worsen the suffering of citizens, particularly in the camps, and will leave them vulnerable to flooding from rainwater and potentially even from high tides," it said, adding that the fuel crisis can also impact the recovery of bodies remaining underneath the rubble.

title: Israel kills over 300 Palestinians in nearly 500 violations of Gaza ceasefire
summary:
Israel kills over 300 Palestinians in nearly 500 violations of Gaza ceasefire

Submitted by MEE staff on Sun, 11/23/2025 - 11:47
Palestinian authorities in Gaza say violations have been ‘systematic’ and threaten ‘prospects for stability’
Civil defence personnel search a burning house targeted by Israeli air strikes in Gaza City, on 22 November 2025 (AFP/Omar al-Qattaa)
Off

Israel has killed 339 Palestinians in nearly 500 ceasefire violations since last month’s truce took effect, according to Gaza authorities.

Gaza’s government media office described the violations as “systematic” and warned they threaten “prospects for stability”.

The statement followed a wave of Israeli air strikes across the Gaza Strip on Saturday, including in areas outside its control. 

At least 21 people were killed, according to the Palestinian health ministry.

Since the ceasefire began on 11 October, the death toll has reached 339, with 871 wounded.

Hamas accused Israel of “inventing pretexts” to justify its actions and undermine the agreement, aiming to resume the two-year genocidal war on Gaza. 

The group said Israel was attempting to “impose a fait accompli”, creating irreversible facts on the ground that contradict the terms of the agreement. 

Hamas called on mediators to intervene to prevent the collapse of the agreement. 

Al Jazeera reported that Hamas sent an “angry” message to mediators after Saturday’s strikes.

However, officials denied that the group had withdrawn from the ceasefire agreement.

Israeli authorities accused Hamas of violating the ceasefire. 

The military said troops came under fire, though no injuries were reported and no Palestinian group claimed responsibility.

A ceasefire in Gaza - but no peace for Palestinians
Read More »

The army released footage of a man firing at a target off-screen, saying he was shooting at soldiers. 

Middle East Eye could not independently verify the location, date or other details of the video. 

Hamas official Izzat al-Rashq denied any link between the man and the group, and called on mediators and the US to pressure Israel to reveal the individual’s identity.

The strikes on Saturday were the latest of growing Israeli ceasefire violations. 

According to the government media office, at least 497 violations have been recorded since 11 October. 

In addition to 339 people killed, Israeli forces detained 35 people. 

Overall, there were 142 incidents of live fire, 21 ground incursions, 228 air, land and artillery strikes, and 100 demolitions of homes and civilian buildings. 

Israel has also kept the Rafah crossing with Egypt closed, blocking the exit of tens of thousands of critically wounded people. 

The closure violates the terms of the agreement, which stipulated that it should be open without restrictions within days of the deal taking effect.

Israel has also continued to block essential food and medical supplies, allowing an average of just 150 aid trucks to enter daily.

The agreement stipulated that 600 trucks should be allowed in without restrictions.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Death toll since start of Gaza ceasefire rises to 339
summary:
Death toll since start of Gaza ceasefire rises to 339

The Palestinian Ministry of Health in Gaza has released new statistics showing that, in the past 24 hours, 23 bodies have arrived at hospitals across the Strip, with a further 83 people wounded.

The latest killings bring the death toll since 10 October to 339. Meanwhile, 871 people have been wounded during the truce period. 

In total, at least 69,756 Palestinians have been killed since the start of Israel's genocidal war in Gaza, with a further 170,946 injured.

title: Israeli forces arrests three Palestinians after settler ramming attack
summary:
Israeli forces arrests three Palestinians after settler ramming attack

Israeli forces arrested three Palestinians after settlers deliberately rammed their vehicle and damaged it south of Hebron in the occupied West Bank, local media reported.

Activist Osama Makhamereh, according to the Wafa news agency, said that Israeli settlers from the newly established illegal outpost of Shimon intentionally struck a vehicle at the village entrance.

Following the ramming, Israeli forces raided the area and detained three young men. 

The arrests are among many carried out since Sunday morning, including the detention of children.

title: Report: Israel faces ‘mental health tsunami’ after two years of war
summary:
Report: Israel faces ‘mental health tsunami’ after two years of war

Israel is facing a “mental health tsunami”, with two million people in need of support as addiction rates soar and families and communities fall apart, according to Yedioth Ahronoth. 

In an extensive report published on Friday, the news outlet said mental health professionals have raised the alarm over a sharp increase in people requiring support since 7 October 2023.

Meanwhile, there is a severe shortage of therapists and support services, which experts warn could have catastrophic consequences.

Last week, a coalition of eight major mental health organisations issued an urgent warning to the government, describing the country’s situation as an “outbreak of mental illness unprecedented in its depth and scope”. 

The groups called the crisis “catastrophic” and demanded immediate government intervention.

Read more: Israel faces ‘mental health tsunami’ after two years of war, report finds

summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – A mourning ceremony for Hazrat Fatemeh Zahra (SA), daughter of Holy Prophet of Islam Hazrat Muhammad (S) and wife of Imam Ali (AS), was held at Ayat Primary School, Ghiyam District, Tehran on Sunday.

title: A plan to humiliate Europe in Ukraine
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – Trump's 28-point plan for Ukraine showed that he tried to secure Russia's opinion rather than being inclined towards NATO and European countries' policies and consulting with them to resolve the crisis.

title: Iran-Russia military coop. progressing according to plans
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – The Iranian Ambassador to Russia Kazem Jalali has said that Moscow and Tehran are advancing their military-defense relations according to the plans, while the enemies are trying hard to find out about that cooperation.

title: Welcoming ceremony for medalist Fatemeh Mohitizadeh at ISG
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 23 (MNA) – The welcoming ceremony from Fatemeh Mohitizadeh, champion at the Islamic Solidarity Games, held on Saturday in Tehran.

title: ربیعی: عکاسان جنگ تنها تصویرگر نیستند، آنان شاهدان تاریخ‌اند
summary: دستیار اجتماعی رئیس جمهور با بیان اینکه جنگ تحمیلی ۱۲ روزه با دروغ آغاز شد، گفت: عکاسی جنگ با بازنمایی واقعیت و ساخت روایت درست، تنها تصویرگر نیستند بلکه شاهد تاریخ‌اند.

title: برخی مراکز آسیب‌دیده در جنگ ۱۲ روزه باید به عنوان سند تاریخی حفظ شوند
summary: نماینده ولی‌فقیه در بنیاد مسکن گفت: برخی از تخریب‌های جنگ تحمیلی ۱۲ روزه که در تهران رخ داد و موجب کشته شدن کودکان، زنان و بیماران شد، باید حفظ شود؛ زیرا این موارد مصداق جنایت جنگی است.

title: آغاز مرمت جامع کاروانسرای شاه‌عباسی ماهیدشت کرمانشاه
summary: کرمانشاه – استاندار کرمانشاه در سفر به بخش ماهیدشت، با تأکید بر احیای آثار تاریخی، دستور آغاز طرح مرمت جامع کاروانسرای شاه‌عباسی این بخش را صادر کرد.

title: کریمی: اجتماع حماسی بانوان زنجانی «مثل زهرا (س)» در زنجان برگزار شد
summary: زنجان- مسئول امور بانوان تبلیغات اسلامی استان زنجان گفت: اجتماع «مثل زهرا (س)» با مشارکت خانم‌های مداح، هیئت دار، روضه‌خوان و سایر فعالان مذهبی به شکل جمعی برگزار شد.

title: عیادت وزیر ورزش از دختر موتورسوار
summary: وزیر ورزش و جوانان وضعیت النا معدنی‌پور را از نزدیک مورد بررسی قرار داد و از او عیادت کرد.

title: قاچاق گوسفند زنده با قایق در آب‌های بندرعباس
summary: بندرعباس- جانشین دریابانی بندرعباس از توقیف یک فروند شناور متخلف و کشف ۴۳ رأس دام زنده قاچاق از نوع گوسفند در آب های این شهرستان خبر داد.

title: تماس رییس فدراسیون فوتبال با اعضای تیم ملی فوتسال
summary: رییس فدراسیون در تماس تلفنی با سرمربی و مدیر تیم ملی فوتسال بانوان، از تلاش، هماهنگی و روحیه جنگندگی بازیکنان مقابل برزیل تقدیر کرد و خواستار ادامه تلاش آنها در جام جهانی شد.
